column4: Description
{GEM} can be used while drafting\nto pay for <color=#FF99D9>Special Floorplans
{COIN} can be used in <color=#FFE47C>Shop Rooms</color>\nfound on the estate to purchase\ngoods and services.
{KEY} can be used to unlock locked\ndoors you find in the house.

{STEP} represent how much energy
you have left for exploring.

Each time you enter a room,
you will lose 1 {STEP}.

When you no longer have any {STEP} left
you must CALL IT A DAY.
column7: Steps are not really an "item", but it is a resource that is lost and gained.
Star is a resource gained via Observatory and other means.

column4: While drafting, you may use \n {DICE} to roll new floorplans.
Your ALLOWANCE has now been\npermanently increased by 2 {COIN}
The only car left on the estate\nshould be in the Garage
Each time you collect 3 {COIN}, earn \nan additional 1 {COIN} in interest.
Draw floorplans leading North more frequently
Save 1 {COIN} on each purchase you\nmake on the Estate.
Opens electronically-powered security doors
Will occasionally be able to open\nsome locked doors.
Greater chance of finding items.
Inspect documents\n\r\rof the estate  \n\r\rmore closely
Greater chance of finding {KEY} and {COIN}.
Occasionally save {STEP} when traveling longer distances across the estate \nand grounds.
Whenever you eat food and\n gain {STEP}, gain an extra 1 {STEP}
Looks like it could be useful for digging.
Can shatter padlocks on locked trunks.
The first time you enter each <color=#AE7EB7>bedroom</color>\nwith the Sleep Mask, gain 5 {STEP} .
A component of the Parlor Game
Provides juice to battery-powered contraptions.
Could prove to be useful.
Unlocking a door with the Silver Key\nleads to a room with many doors.
For the next one minute, you will not\nlose {STEP} when entering rooms, {KEY} when opening doors or {GEM} when drafting special rooms.
Insert into one of the Estate Terminals\nto permanently upgrade one of\nyour Floorplans.
When you reach Rank 5\ntoday, gain 10 {STEP}.

If you unlock a door with the Prism Key in a\n<color=#4BDB52>Green Room, </color><color=#D68F2D>Hallway, </color><color=#9877FA>Bedroom, </color><color=#E92434>Red Room, </color>or <color=#D0D25C>Shop</color>, you will draw floorplans of\nthat same color.
Gain an additional effect of each constellation\nobserved in the Observatory.

You will not lose {STEP} traveling
between two adjoining <color=#DE7E27>Hallways</color>.

<color=#DE7E27>Hallways</color> drafted from an adjoining
<color=#DE7E27>Hallway</color> do not cost {GEM} to draft.
Finding it won't be easy.
A stronger Sledge Hammer that\ncan also knock down weaker brick\nwalls.
More effective than the shovel at excavation.\nDigs deeper and finds better items.
Can light candles and ignite fuses.
Doubles all the {COIN} you find.
Greater chance of picking\nhigh sensitivity locks.
Unlocks the Basement Door
If you call it a day while wearing the\nMoon Pendant, tomorrow you will start\nwith two of the items in your inventory.
Opens all doors in the estate that can\nbe opened with standard keys.
You no longer have\nto pay floorplan\ngem costs.
While drafting, you may rotate the\nfirst three floorplans you draw.

The former Ruby Crown of Orinda Aries, recently set with freshly cut sapphires. The first time you draw a RED ROOM while drafting, you may remove it from today's draft pool. If you do, gain 1 {GEM} and redraw floorplans.
Secrets from beyond the grave.
Presumably will unlock Room 8

If there is not a <color=#E72222>Red Room</color> among
the first three floorplans you draw while drafting, you may redraw floorplans.

<color=#989898>(Also useful for rehearsing museum burglary)

When you pick up Royal Scepter, choose a color.
Floorplans of the chosen color are
more common today.

If you call it a day in a room matching the
chosen color, Royal Scepter will not be
lost at the end of the day.
A key crafted from infused second era gold and soot-black onyx, adorned with the original insignia of the Aries family crest.
Whenever you gain {STEP} from eating,\ngain twice that many {STEP}.
While drafting, you may <color="#49d6ff"><-REWIND-</color> time\nafter drawing new floorplans. {TMR} You are more likely to draw \nTomorrow Rooms while drafting.
